explanation: toxdigitvalue: Called from this function; include its prototype to confirm it does not take or return pointers (so it cannot affect whether str could be const). MHD_str_pct_decode_in_place_lenient_: Used in the MHD_FAVOR_SMALL_CODE branch — its prototype/signature is needed to see whether it modifies the buffer pointed to by str (if it writes into str, then str cannot be const). unescape_wrapper: A caller of this function; inspect how callers pass the buffer (do they have const char * and cast away const?) — this affects whether changing the parameter to const would be compatible with callers. MHD_FAVOR_SMALL_CODE: The compile-time macro controls which code path is active; you must know its definition at analysis time to determine whether the function writes into str via the small-code branch (calls lenient function and may set str[0]=0) or via the in-place decoding loop (writes into str[w++]).
